org.mokai
Interface ConnectorService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCamelConnectorService, CamelApplicationService, CamelConnectionService
public interface ConnectorService
extends Service

A wrapper of a Connector that holds a collection of acceptors, pre-processing actions, post-processing actions and post-receiving actions.

Inside a RoutingEngine, it represents an application or a connection capable of receiving or processing messages.

Author:
German Escobar
See Also:
RoutingEngine, Connector, Acceptor, Action

Method Detail

getId

String getId()
Returns:
the assigned id.

getPriority

int getPriority()
The priority is used by the RoutingEngine to determine the order in which the connector services should be query in order to accept or reject a message. The priority only applies to connectors that implement the Processor interface.

Returns:
the priority of this connector service.

setPriority

void setPriority(int priority)
Sets the priority. This value is used to determine the order in which the connector services should be query in order to accept or reject a message. The priority only applies to connectors that implement the Processor interface.

Parameters:
priority - can be a positive or negative number.

withPriority

ConnectorService withPriority(int priority)
Helper method to set a priority using a fluent API.

Parameters:
priority - a positive or negative number.
Returns:
this connector service.
See Also:
setPriority(int)

getMaxConcurrentMsgs

int getMaxConcurrentMsgs()
The maximum number of messages that can be processed concurrently by the connector. This only applies to connectors that implement the Processor interface.

Returns:
the maximum number of messages that can be processed concurrently.

setMaxConcurrentMsgs

void setMaxConcurrentMsgs(int maxConcurrentMsgs)
Sets the maximum number of messages that can be processed concurrently by the connector. This only applies to connectors that implement the Processor interface.

Parameters:
maxConcurrentMsgs - the maximum number of messages that can be processed concurrently.

getConnector

Connector getConnector()
The wrapped connector.

Returns:
the Connector that this connector service is wrapping.

getNumQueuedMessages

int getNumQueuedMessages()
After a Message is accepted by the processor service, it queues the messages for future processing.

Returns:
the number of messages that are queued

getStatus

Monitorable.Status getStatus()
The status tells whether the service is ok or not. The status is calculated by first checking the status of the Connector (if it implements Monitorable). If the connector implements then this method also checks if the last message failed or was successfully processed.

Returns:
the status of the connector service.
See Also:
Monitorable.Status

addAcceptor

ConnectorService addAcceptor(Acceptor acceptor)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                    ObjectAlreadyExistsException
Adds an Acceptor to the collection of acceptors if it doesn't exists. Existence of an acceptor is determined by the Acceptor#equals(Object) method.

Parameters:
acceptor - the Acceptor instance to be added.
Returns:
the ConnectorService instance (fluent API).
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the acceptor is null.
ObjectAlreadyExistsException - if the acceptor already exists.

removeAcceptor

ConnectorService removeAcceptor(Acceptor acceptor)
                                throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                       ObjectNotFoundException
Removes an Acceptor from the collection of acceptors if it exists. Existence of an acceptor is determined by the Acceptor#equals(Object) method.

Parameters:
acceptor - the Acceptor instance to be removed.
Returns:
the ConnectorService instance (fluent API).
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null.
ObjectNotFoundException - if the acceptor is not found.

getAcceptors

List<Acceptor> getAcceptors()
Retrieves the registered acceptors.

Returns:
a list of Acceptor objects or an empty list if no acceptor has been added.
